E0 Need for FM daytime test period: Several member stations, especially those
operated by public school systems, have expressed the desire ior a daytime test
period, indicating the extreme difficulty of testing during the hours' of. 1:00 - 6:00 am.
This matter was discussed and some hesitancy shown to a formal request from the
NAEB to the FCC for such a special privilege. This because the purpose of the present
test period was to reduce interference and such interference could be as objectionable
from educational FM stations as from any others. The matter was referred to
Mr, Braum who contacted the FCC and reported as follows: The FCC will accept
requests for special temporary authority to conduct tests of FM transmitters
during the daytime hours, and whenever possible such permission will be granted.
It was also indicated that authority to conduct these daytime tests might be
granted for rather extended periods, but it is advised that the actual time of
such test be limited to possibly 15 minutes before the regular broadcast day and
that no more than two sustained frequencies be used during any single test period.
F. Proposed FCC regulations re harmonic and spurious radiation. This matter
was discussed at length and Mr. Braum reported that there was presently
considerable question as to the exact proposed requirements and methods.
